org.grants.google.cse

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grants.google.cse.Query

  • public class Query
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to perform a Google Query.

    This class require Google Custom Search Engine ID and Google API Key

    To obtain it, please follow this manual: https://developers.google.com/custom-search/json-api/v1/overview

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Dmitrij Kudriavcev, dmitrij@kudriavcev.info

    • Method Detail

      • getJsonFolder

        public java.lang.String getJsonFolder()
        Returns:
        Folder to store JSON files.

      • setJsonFolder

        public void setJsonFolder(java.lang.String jsonFolder)
        Function to set a path to store JSON files, returned from Google.

        If folder is set, the each response from a Google will be stored into this folder. Next, if request with same text occurs, the response will be read from this folder rather that query Google. This can save time and money, but also could be potentially dangerous, because the response could be too old. Also the folder could grown rapidly and need to be clean periodically.

        Parameters:
        jsonFolder -

      • query

        public QueryResponse query(java.lang.String queryString)
        Function will sent query to the Google. Each Query will be enclosed in "" to force Google to return only pages, contains exact string. The query string will be also URLEncoded with UTF-8 encoding.

        If Json Folder has been set, the function will first search request string in the folder and will return cached results, if they exists. It will also cache any new result in this folder for future use.

        Parameters:
        queryString - A query string without a quotes and non encoded.
        Returns:
        QueryResponse
